result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua R. Dombrowik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

W/Huber for all purposes

To commence on/before

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

1:40 p.m. Defendant Joshua R. Dombrowik in court.  Calling 15cm56, 10fo1653, 08cm312, 16tr1822, 16tr1821, 15tr2210, 15tr2211, 15tr1498, 15tr1497.  Defendant states missed last court appearance because he was school shopping and is making voluntary appearance. Defendant statement to no insurance ticket received. Court states cases are old - last payment was in May. Court provides defendant list of amounts owed and reminds Defendant of attorneys fees owed since 2008. Defendant states he has been paying child support instead of fines. Defendant states he can pay $100/month. Court orders $75 monthly payment. Defendant states he is looking at tatoo shop in Antigo - to work - is unsure whether he needs separate license to work in Antigo. Adj. 1:46 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for November 28, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

3:52 p.m. Defendant Joshua R Dombrowik in court.  Defendant can pay $300 today. Calling 08 tr3024, 10fo1236, 10fo1653, 14fo1141, 14tr1538, 15cm56,15tr1497,15tr1498, 15tr2209, 15tr2210, 15tr2211. Defendant's truck broke and had to use money for fixing truck. Defendant states he operates tatoo shop downtown - road construction has slowed business. Adj. 3:54 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for August 29, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

3:24 p.m. Defendant Joshua R. Dombrowik in court. Calling 14tr1538, 14fo1141, 10fo1653, 15cm56, 15tr1497, 15tr1498, 15TR2211, 15tr2210, 15tr2209, 10fo1236, 08tr3024. Defendant states that his income has taken "a hit" with lack of snowmobiling. Court authorizes Community Service at $10/hr - still requiring $100 per month. Adj. 3:27 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Notified Judy at ONSO - voluntary appearance - payment plan

2:11 p.m. Defendant Joshua R. Dombrowik in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Reviewing all cases with outstanding warrants. 15cm56, 15tr2211, 15tr2210, 15tr2209, 15cm56, 14tr1498, 14tr1497, 14tr1538, 14fo1141, 10fo1653, 10fo1236, 08tr3024. Defendant states he is employed and would like review hearing scheduled - made $500 payment yesterday - Defendant states he can make $100 monthly payment - Court grants $100 monthly payments - will raise monthly payment at next review - if misses monthly payment - warrant will be issued. Warrants quashed. Adj. 2:18 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
3:12 p.m. No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

02:51 pm - Defendant Joshua R. Dombrowik in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads no contest to each count.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Michlig/Drewa/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence - Each Count Concurrent
Court Costs/DNA Surcharge
Jail 10 days w/Huber for all purposes - May serve sentence over the weekends - To commence on/before 7-31-15 @ 4pm
Appeal rights given  Review hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Joshua R. Dombrowik in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:07
In receipt, waive reading - not guilty plea
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

02:41 pm - Defendant Joshua R. Dombrowik in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states found out this past Friday that the attorney thought was retained is not able to represent - requests adjournment to obtain counsel.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

01:27 pm - Defendant Joshua R. Dombrowik in court, via video. in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
